comment: Definitely take this professor for Vis Com! Super easy class and interesting topic. She makes the class really fun. 3 Journal assignments, weekly Discussion posts (easy), 6 quizzes (easy but need book), and 1 Corporate Image assignment (very easy). Get the book, you'll need it. I can't say enough great things about this professor! Easy A for sure!

Seriously take her! This is the best teacher at KSU, hands down. Teresa is WONDERFUL. You WILL get an A in this class,  I promise. The assignments are time consuming, but very easy. The final is made to help you and it's over a movie we watch in class. No tests, just quizzes. I wish I could take her over and over again. I really enjoyed this class!

Glad I waited to take her for VisCom. There are 6 papers in this class, but they're easy as long as you space them out. NO tests, only a few quizzes, which are easy if you go to class! Dudenhoeffer is so friendly and approachable, and wants to make sure everyone succeeds. Easy A if you do the work and turn it in on time.
Seriously TAKE HER! She is the easiest teacher i have had at KSU. Super easy going and will work with you
One of the best teachers I've had at KSU. Was a really easy course as long as you actually did your work. I would take her for all my classes if i could!

She has a quirky personality. I always enjoyed her class. It is straightforward. Follow her syllabus, submit the work on time, and you'll be fine. As far as the test are concerned, they are taken online and timed. So please make sure to read the book and look over the PowerPoints ahead of time. Plus, she's an easy grader!

I LOVED TERESA AND THIS CLASS SO MUCH! Take her, Take her, Take her. She is amazing and makes public speaking a breeze. She is so helpful and an easy grader. She gives extra credit on days no one shows up. The speeches are easy, you pick your own topic and have fun with it. I can not wait to take her for Visual Com. Everyone needs to take her!!
Amazing teacher! Really easy class! You will love your life.

A wonderful teacher! She doesn't ask for much except for students to pay attention. She dislikes when students don't participate and are too busy on their electronics. Her homework are easy if you pace yourself. Do not wait until the last minute! Her requirements for each assignments are on her syllabus and its clear cut!

She was literally one of my favorite professors I have ever taken. This class was easy if you do all of the work. Yeah it is a lot of busy work, but it's easy and fun. She cares about her students so much and wants to see them succeed. I had her for 2 classes in the same semester and she was awesome. TAKE HER!
Super fun teacher! Nice, easy, friendly, & helpful

She's good. Many writing assignments, they're easy but time-consuming. The key is to *Do Them at a Steady Pace* (aka NOT at the last minute), and *Follow Their Simple Grading Criteria in the Syllabus*. Easy. Study the lecture for 5 minutes for a good quiz score. Easy A, enthusiastic teacher, possibly the only VisComm class with 0 group assignments.

She's cool. A bit quirky. Truly cares about students succeeding, is truly disappointed when students don't participate, just because she respects you and knows you can do well. She's great if you want class discussions (which you should; don't just show up, learn). Zero group assignments (awesome). Lengthy but easy journal submissions. I like her.

I had her class as a hybrid--she was pretty easy, just do the assignments, quizzes and post on the discussion board and you're solid. I only use the book for quizzes because the answers are literally verbatim what you find in the textbook.  I would definitely recommend taking her class over any other visual comm professor!

Maiden name Alvarez - look her up. Took as a hybrid. Great class - got to watch movies and movie clips.  STAY ON TOP OF THE JOURNAL ASSIGNMENTS. Don't buy the book! All tests come from online lectures and in-class discussion.  She's funny and insightful.  Take her if you can get in.  I was waitlisted, got in, and didn't regret it.
